list: The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions, about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.

Questions are updated regularly to reflect important topics impacting the business community, and as the economy changes, the survey will continue to be updated to measure the impact of new issues businesses face.
Some questions are repeated monthly to monitor changes over time.
Your response helps ensure your business, and businesses like yours, are represented.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

content.description: Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)

list: Information should relate to sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
On average it takes 10 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

content.description: This section asks for information about CE and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.
This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: percentage, for example, of those working from home, using a hybrid model or made redundant in the last two weeks

content.description: This section asks for information about the changes to the numbers of workers from within and outside the EU.
We are asking these questions to help understand how workforce characteristics may have changed across different business sectors.

blocks.title: Trading status of your business
blocks.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s trading status?
questions.description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: Please explain the reason for {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s paused trading status

blocks.title: Supply chains
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • any changes to supply chains
  • the availability of materials, goods and services within the EU
  • the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} made changes to supply chains due to the end of the EU transition period?

definitions.title: What we mean by the 'end of the EU transition period'

content.description: The transition period was when the UK was no longer a member of the EU but continued to be subject to EU rules and remained a member of the single market and customs union. This ended on 31 December 2020. For further information about the transition go to GOV.UK/transition (this link opens in a new tab).

questions.title: Were these changes to supply chains made as a result of a new UK trade agreement?
In which of the following ways has your business changed supply chains due to the end of the EU transition period?

options.label: Expanding to different modes of freight
options.value: Expanding to different modes of freight
options.description: For example, air freight, lift-on/lift-off flights, rail freights or roll-on/roll-off ferries

options.label: Moving the supply chain away from the short straits crossings
options.value: Moving the supply chain away from the short straits crossings
options.description: For example, the Euro tunnel and ferry routes between the Port of Dover and Calais, Coquelles or Dunkirk

options.label: Using more non-EU suppliers
options.description: The rest of the world, excluding EU and UK

questions.title: Has your business had any extra costs due to the end of the EU transition period?

options.label: Costs associated with changing supply chains
options.value: Costs associated with changing supply chains

options.label: Costs associated with the storage of goods
options.value: Costs associated with the storage of goods

options.label: Costs due to increased red tape
options.value: Costs due to increased red tape
options.description: For example, customs and rules of origin paperwork

options.label: Cost of setting up EU subsidiaries
options.value: Cost of setting up EU subsidiaries

options.label: Extra costs in the prices of goods and services imported
options.value: Extra costs in the prices of goods and services imported

questions.title: Was your business able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from the EU over the last month?

options.label: Yes, the business has been able to get the materials, goods or services it needed
options.value: Yes, the business has been able to get the materials, goods or services it needed

options.label: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
options.value: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions

options.label: No, the business has not been able to get the materials, goods or services needed
options.value: No, the business has not been able to get the materials, goods or services needed

questions.title: Was your business able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from within the UK over the last month?

options.label: Yes, the business has been able to get the materials, goods or services it needed
options.value: Yes, the business has been able to get the materials, goods or services it needed

options.label: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
options.value: Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions

options.label: No, the business has not been able to get the materials, goods or services needed
options.value: No, the business has not been able to get the materials, goods or services needed

blocks.title: Prices
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • demand for goods and services over the last month
  • changes to energy prices
  • price rises experienced by your business

questions.title: How did the prices of materials, goods or services bought by {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} change over the last month, compared with normal price fluctuations?

options.label: Prices did not change any more than normal
options.value: Prices did not change any more than normal

options.label: Some prices increased, some prices decreased
options.value: Some prices increased, some prices decreased

questions.title: Please explain the reason for selecting '{{ answers['answerc94ef925-704e-4784-a3cd-f28e4c468390'] }}'
questions.description: If you selected 'Not sure' or 'Not applicable', please still provide commentary as it helps us better understand how your business is operating in the current climate.

options.label: Prices did not change any more than normal
options.value: Prices did not change any more than normal

questions.description: If you selected 'Not sure' or 'Not applicable', please still provide commentary as it helps us better understand how your business is operating in the current climate.

questions.title: Has your business had an increase in demand for goods or services sold over the last month?
Has your business been affected by recent increases in energy prices?

content.description: Include:

options.label: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected
options.value: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected

options.label: No, my business has not been affected
options.value: No, my business has not been affected

questions.title: Are your business's electricity costs fixed or hedged?

content.description: Include electricity costs which are fixed or hedged both fully or partially
This refers to prices that are insured and agreed at an earlier date, so businesses pay a fixed price for their utilities.

questions.title: Are your business's gas costs fixed or hedged?

content.description: Include gas costs which are fixed or hedged both fully or partially
This refers to prices that are insured and agreed at an earlier date, so businesses pay a fixed price for their utilities.

questions.title: In which of the following ways, if any, has your business been affected by price rises?

content.description: Include any price rises that your business has experienced

options.label: Had to absorb costs
options.description: For example, business took no action or used cash reserves

options.label: Had to pass on price increases to customers
options.value: Had to pass on price increases to customers

options.label: Had to reduce staff work hours
options.value: Had to reduce staff work hours

options.label: Unable to maintain workspaces
options.description: For example, due to rising energy costs

options.label: My business has not been affected by price rises
options.value: My business has not been affected by price rises

blocks.title: Sending goods to or from Northern Ireland
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about sending goods from GB to Northern Ireland, as well as from Northern Ireland to GB, and any related challenges.

Include

Goods sent to:

  • other businesses
  • other parts of your business
  • individual customers

GB means ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} sent goods from GB to Northern Ireland in the last 12 months?

content.description: Include
Goods sent from GB to Northern Ireland to:
This refers to ‘Great Britain’ which includes England, Scotland and Wales, but excludes Northern Ireland.

options.value: From GB via Republic of Ireland

blocks.title: Stock and capital expenditure

  • the business's stock levels and stockpiling
  • changes to capital expenditure
  • scrapping capital assets

questions.title: How do {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}’s stock levels over the last month compare to normal expectations for this time of year?

options.label: Stock levels are higher than normal
options.value: Stock levels are higher than normal

options.label: Stock levels are lower than normal
options.value: Stock levels are lower than normal

values: Stock levels are higher than normal

options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

questions.title: Is your business stockpiling any goods or materials?

questions.title: Please explain in more detail how your business's capital expenditure has been affected
How do you expect the super-deduction allowance to affect your business's capital expenditure in the next three months?

content.description: This is a new capital allowance on qualifying plant and machinery investments which was announced in the March 2021 Budget.

options.label: Capital expenditure will remain the same
options.value: Capital expenditure will remain the same

questions.title: Over the last month, has your business scrapped any capital assets earlier than intended?

content.description: Exclude capital assets which are sold
This refers to assets that are retired from their use in the production process.

questions.title: Please explain in more detail what type of assets your business scrapped early and why

blocks.title: UK Conformity Assessed (UKCA) marking
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about CE and UKCA markings.

These are markings that apply to a wide range of consumer and industrial goods such as toys, personal protective equipment, and construction products. The markings signal that products are fit to be placed on the GB market.

questions.title: Does your business manufacture, import, or distribute products that require either a CE marking or the new UKCA marking?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'CE and UKCA markings'

content.description: The UKCA (UK Conformity Assessed) marking is a new UK product marking that is used for goods being placed on the market in GB. It covers most goods that previously required the CE (Conformity with European health, safety, and environment) marking.

options.label: Yes, we manufacture products that  need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we manufacture products that  need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

options.label: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
options.value: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

values: No, we do not manufacture, import or distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we manufacture products that  need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we import products that need a CE or UKCA marking
Yes, we distribute products that need a CE or UKCA marking

questions.title: Is your business aware that most CE marked products need to be UKCA marked from 1 January 2023?
questions.description: In August 2021, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by one year from 1 January 2022 to 1 January 2023, for most products.

questions.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, the UKCA marking by 1 January 2023?
questions.description: In August 2021, it was announced that the deadline for businesses to apply UKCA markings will be extended by one year from 1 January 2022 to 1 January 2023, for most products.

options.label: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA
options.value: Not aware of, or do not know how to meet, requirements for the UKCA

options.label: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2023
options.value: Not using the UKCA marking, but plan to by 1 January 2023

options.label: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business
options.value: Will not use UKCA marking, as not relevant to our products or business

blocks.title: Operational performance
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

  • percentage, for example, of those working from home, using a hybrid model or made redundant in the last two weeks
  • coronavirus (COVID-19) testing and contact tracing
  • worker shortages
  • ability to fill vacancies over the last month

questions.title: In the last two weeks, approximately what percentage of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce were:
questions.description:
If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

Your answers need to add up to 100%. If your workforce did not fall into any of the top five categories, enter '0', then use the 'Other' box at the bottom to bring the total to 100%.

Informed estimates are acceptable.

content.description: Include both full-time and part-time employees

answers.label: Using a hybrid model of working
answers.description: For example, using a mixture of working from home and a designated workspace

answers.label: On sick leave, or not working due to coronavirus (COVID-19) symptoms, self-isolation or quarantine

guidance.show_guidance: What we mean by a 'designated workspace'
guidance.hide_guidance: What we mean by a 'designated workspace'

content.description: This refers to a workplace, excluding the home.
Examples include:

list: community or shared work-spaces such as Hubs
work vehicles such as HGVs, vans and company cars

questions.title: Is your business providing regular coronavirus (COVID-19) testing for its workforce?

content.description: Include:
Exclude:

definitions.title: What we mean by 'regular coronavirus (COVID-19) testing'

content.description: This means that the business is testing the workforce on a routine basis to check for COVID cases, regardless of whether workers are asymptomatic. For example, testing once a week.

questions.title: What percentage of your workforce are receiving regular coronavirus (COVID-19) testing?

answers.label: Approximate percentage of your workforce receiving regular testing
Or select 'Not sure' if the percentage is not known or is too difficult to calculate

questions.title: Is your business collecting, or intending to collect, contact details for the purpose of contact tracing at your sites?
questions.description: Dependent upon your business type this may involve collecting contact details from customers, staff or visitors.

content.description: This refers to a procedure used to help prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19). Contact tracing aims to identify and alert people who have come into contact with an infected person.

guidance.show_guidance: Why are we asking this question?
guidance.hide_guidance: Why are we asking this question?

content.description: We want to understand how changes to legislation might be impacting contact tracing procedures for businesses.

questions.title: Is your business currently experiencing a shortage of workers?
How has the shortage of workers affected your business?

options.label: Had to pause trading of some of the business
options.value: Had to pause trading of some of the business

options.label: My business has not been affected
options.value: My business has not been affected

questions.title: How does your business's ability to fill vacancies in the last month compare with normal expectations for this time of year?

options.label: No difference in the ability to fill vacancies
options.value: No difference in the ability to fill vacancies

options.label: Vacancies were more difficult to fill
options.value: Vacancies were more difficult to fill

options.label: Did not have any vacancies to fill
options.value: Did not have any vacancies to fill

values: No difference in the ability to fill vacancies
Did not have any vacancies to fill

questions.title: Why did your business find filling vacancies more difficult, over the last month, compared with normal expectations for this time of year?

options.label: Business cannot offer an attractive pay package to applicants
options.value: Business cannot offer an attractive pay package to applicants
options.description: For example, additional benefits, competitive pay and flexible working hours

options.label: Increased number of vacancies for other reasons
options.value: Increased number of vacancies for other reasons
options.description: For example, business growth and diversification, or new work opportunities

options.label: Lack of qualified applicants for the roles on offer
options.value: Lack of qualified applicants for the roles on offer
options.description: For example, applicants lacking the experience, qualifications or skills required

options.label: Low number of applications for the roles on offer
options.value: Low number of applications for the roles on offer

options.label: Reduced number of applicants aged 16 to 24 years
options.value: Reduced number of applicants aged 16 to 24 years

options.label: Reduced number of applicants aged over 50 years
options.value: Reduced number of applicants aged over 50 years

blocks.title: Workforce characteristics
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about the changes to the numbers of workers from within and outside the EU.

We are asking these questions to help understand how workforce characteristics may have changed across different business sectors.

questions.title: How has the number of workers from within the EU at {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} changed, compared with normal expectations for this time of year?

content.description: Exclude those from the UK (England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland)
